p.s: How to bless a person , group , place or thing .

item.s: Figure out exactly who or what the blessing is going to be for .
Using names is always best .
Think about what attributes you want to create or enhance in the object of the blessing .
Traits such as peace , strength , courage , wit , kindness , grace , good looks , health , happiness , long life , justice , and prosperity are some possibilities .
If you 're religious , look at your scripture for ideas .
There might be a verse or quote you want to use , or there may be pre-written blessings you can recite .
If you 're not religious or do n't want to do a religious-sounding blessing , look up some other kinds of quotes , especially poetry .
Even songs .
These can be inspirational even if you choose to write your own blessing .
Compose the words of the blessing .
You can write them down or memorize them , but make sure you know what you 're going to say before you say it .
Just as with a toast or a speech , you do n't want to spoil it by forgetting the words or stumbling .
Keep it concise : it should n't take more than two minutes to say the whole thing , and preferably less time than that .
If you want to , you can include a ritual of any sort you like .
Try reading up on rituals , rites and superstitions to get some ideas .
Start with traditions from your own ancestry or ethnicity .
To bless a person , place your hand on his or her head .
Traditionally the right hand , which in most people is stronger , is the best one to use .
If touching is unacceptable , hold your hand above the person .
Recite the blessing .
Have a drink or a special treat to celebrate , or give the object of the blessing a gift .
Do n't use the blessing as a lecture .
You can also bless a house , a place of business , the food you eat , or anything you make with your hands .

Different people have different ideas of what a blessing actually does ; depending on your point of view , it 's a request to the higher Power to bestow the real gifts , or it 's an expression of your will with the hope that what you want will become manifest .
Use phrases in the future tense , such as " May you ...
A blessing does n't guarantee good things , but it might help .
In some cultures , it 's traditional to bless children when they reach certain stages of life , or even on a regular basis .
Blessings can be public or private .
You can do it with a large audience or on your own .
Invoke the attributes of people you admire .
You can compare the person you 're blessing to somebody who is already great .
Again , keep the words of your blessing short .
It 's the thought that counts .
Be smart when you 're composing the blessing , and word it so that it wo n't offend the person you 're blessing or somebody watching .
If in doubt , skip any mention of deities ( God or gods ) .
